title: People are annoyed you cant chase a Kalista...
body: Her sole purpose is to kite. That is what she was designed to be, the insanely kitey adc. Do you chase singed? No. Its just something you dont do. Learn not to try to chase a kalista. Do however rito put a cap on E towards monsters and make the spears change color when they become lethal on a target.

I don't have to chase Singed, but when Singed is autoattacking me at 550 range, I happen to think that it is a good idea to get rid of that sadistic bunny before my team gets slaughtered.
The insanely kitey adc who outsmites junglers, and oututilitizes Ashe and Varus, and melts tanks?
Note how i did say put a cap on E.

This is a fair point in general, you shouldn't be CHASING a kalista, but when you gank as udyr and catch her out, she shouldn't be able to get out of a pincer while also autoattacking and be able to not take a single hit from udyr. Especially since the strong slows in the game like Zileans and Nunus that counter every other peel strat don't do shit because her kiting mechanic is unaffected by slows, only hard cc works.
Then gank her early when she is weakest and has low attackspeed. Low AS=Not as many jumps.

It would be nice if that actually required some high amount of attack speed, like finish her Hurricane at the very least, but it seems like she's gone from any movespeed based ganks after just her level 2 boots and a recursive bow. So your options are basically to gank before her first back, or you're totally useless to your bot lane, and since none of the movespeed reliant junglers are on the level 2-3 gank list and probably will back before their first gank, that's a really small window of usefulness.

Problem with Kalista is that there is no counterplay to her mobility. Even if you have your own mobility, she has it on a passive and will out "mobility" anyone else. 

Picking a melee champion that uses movement speed to catch their targets that at one time could still work, are just impossible to use right now vs her. In general, MS buffs should out preform dashes/teleports in the long run. But Kalista does not fill this. If you're looking for distance Ghost will get you further than Flash. 

When Kassadin was at a 90% ban rate his existence pushed almost all immobile mages out of the game. Kalistia is doing the same thing. But it's OK because you're not supposed to chase her? 

No one should be impossible to catch like that. Even Kassadin had to pay for his mobility. He couldn't do it forever. And he couldn't continue to attack while doing it unless he used it to close a gap. He's melee and his ranged damage is limited by cooldowns. 

And how do you figure Kalista is not meant to be chased? ADC's are always a high priority target. Signed is rarely a high priority target. 

- Put a cap on her E on monsters.
- Remove the bonus range when dashing backwards on her passive
- Lower the slow on her E. 

If too much she can get buffs in other places. 

- Increase range on passive when dashing after using her Q.
- Champions spotted by her W gain double Rend stacks. 
- After her ally lands R, she gains increased passive range when dashing tward them
- Gains increased range dashing to linked ally. This could also just replace the increased range when going backwards. Meaning if you linked to a tank you're likely not going to kite as well. But if you're with say a Nami, if they can manage to stay behind you, you can kite better. Although this can make the skill even more technical than it already is and may be too much.

Can i Just say I love you? Your not one of the people to scream KALISTA QQ and say remove her passive. You actually put thought into some of these changes. 
I do agree that the Bonus Range on Backwards should come at a cost, and i feel like 10% Reduced AA Dmg when leaping backwards would be good, but with 10% increased AA dmg when leaping forward. This would give her the choice, Go backwards and stay safe but reduced dmg, or go forward towards the enemy but with increased dmg.

In a way I do think it should. At least from Kalista. 

I find her passive to be better on a melee. It just has so much more counterplay that way. You can simply walk the other way when they dash one way. Creating a gap between the two players. Kalista can stay in a middle ground where you can't reach her, but she stays just far enough that she can AA and chase if you try to move a different direction.

But it's too late for that.

We're conditioned to set them behind as far back as possible to delay the inevitable. Why else do you think the support is sent bot lane early game with them?

She was actually designed without the passive and then someone else at Riot suggested "I'd like it if your spear throwing champ jumped every time she threw the spear."
Regardless, she does ADC level damage and can chase just as well as she can escape. It's not like you can just ignore her.

I've never found her to be even a little OP though. Vayne is arguably just as hard to lock down with her Tumbles(especially invisi ones) and Condemn plus harder to run from with that passive. Meanwhile Vayne also does a lot more damage.
She does subpar damage to someone like a jinx or graves and has less overall utility then an ashe/varus.

> [{quoted}](name=LittleBlast,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=k5zYv0Ju,comment-id=000d0001,timestamp=2015-02-24T11:12:09.482+0000)

> She does subpar damage to someone like a jinx or graves and has less overall utility then an ashe/varus.

I'm not sure how she has less utility than Ashe or Varus. She has an engage type ult like both of your examples and trades their (mediocre, AP scaling) damage for better CC (Ashe's stun is single target, Kalista can knockup multiple people and knockups are better than snares). Her ult is also useful as a get out of jail free card for her support. She doesn't have Ashe's permaslow or Varus's ground slow but what she does have is a powerful one-off (AOE with Hurricane) slow and permanent dashes, meaning her kiting/gapclosing is far superior regardless.

She doesn't have the grievous wounds Varus has but instead she gets costless skillshot evasion. She has a vision tool, like Ashe, but hers is infinitely better due to being longlasting. She has %max HP damage like Varus, but hers is stronger, and she has a very very powerful burst attack in Rend to more than make up for her ultimate dealing no damage.

Damage is hard to compare but when it comes to utility Kalista has Ashe and Varus massively outgunned. All she lacks is Varus's grievous wounds but she's more than happy to lose that in exchange for everything else she brings to the team.  What makes you think Ashe and Varus have more utility than Kalista, or are you just defending her from all criticism?

Huh. I remember when being the kiting ADC meant that you were {{champion:22}}. The mobility creep is real.
Can there not be multiple of a role? Ashe is actually better than kalista in some cases, a niche pick adc with not to rare of a niche.

There can be multiples of a role, it's just not a great idea. Champions should all have their one unique niche they fill.

Unfortunately, I wouldn't consider {{champion:22}} much of a kiting champion anymore. League has gotten to the point where her permaslows and stun mean next to nothing against champs that have multiple gapclosers that ignore the slows. It's now to the point where the kiting ADC is the champion with a hop literally every auto attack, a slow, and a (potential) knockup on the ult. All that JUST to kite the other champions. It's insane.

That's all really beside the point anyway. Even in the older seasons you could still catch and punish Ashe with most champions if you outplayed her. Kali is only really vulnerable in the early levels with little attack speed, then by mid game becomes untouchable by half the roster.
For example, how is a {{champion:86}} supposed to catch her? Even if he waits in a bush she facechecks and delivers a silence, she *still has her mobility*.

I'm all for having champions having their own niche, but right now Kali is too mobile even for the game's kiting champion.

She'll just take your tower very fast due to her high AD and high AS.

Singed is and always will be a terrible comparison to Kalista. His entire kit is based around bad stuff happening to those who chase him and he's entirely ignorable if you're not doing that. He's also actually possible to hit with crowd control and pin down.

You cannot ignore Kalista because she is an ADC. You try catching her because an ignored ADC decimates entire teams. You try catching her because the second you turn around to run away she changes her plan and instead of dashing away from you, dashes towards you, slowly stacking Rend on you until she's ready to slow & murder you.

"Don't chase Kalista" will become an acceptable tip when someone presents an actually good way to deal with her that isn't "use targeted CC".
